lenders.name: janis-karmic stone
lenders.loan_because:
of my committment to karma yoga- the practice of helping others. A portion of the proceeds from each work of art is donated to kiva. 

The ability to help others in a meaningful way gives my art, and therby my life, true purpose.
lenders.occupational_info:
As an artist on the path to self-discovery and a desire to be more present and alive, "karmic stone" evolved.

Mindfulness, meditation, a passion for yoga, the search for balance and the need to slow down and embrace life all combined to create the opportunity for karmic stone to manifest itself.

I was drawn to stone as a medium in which to express my creativity while seeking my own sense of permanence and the need to be grounded.

Stone provided a solid foundation from which to grow. While I had been an architectural designer and preferred the blank page, I discovered that stone holds many secrets and mysteries, which come together in creating a work of art. Each type of stone has its own unique texture, underlying colors, wich may or may not reveal themselves, density, and a unique history- from its origins and formation to how it has evolved over the ages.

Each work of art requires mindfulness and focus. As a design is carved, the stone presents its own uniqueness just as it is supposed to. Just as in life, unfolding as it is supposed to. Right now. In this moment.

lenders.name: Melissa
lenders.loan_because: I've been where these people are; with just a little help I made it.  I would like to do the same for someone else.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for my husband in the construction industry.

I know what it means to be poor and have no food or shelter.  But God's LOVE is greatest...through mutual love and understanding let us work out our differences.

Rather, you can decide which activities to fund and can at least get a sense of the impact that your contribution is making.

We've been pretty lucky so far...It is our sincere hope that people we loan to can feel the same way!
lenders.occupational_info: I owned and operated a manufacturing facility for 30 years. I worked very hard, long hours and had the very good fortune to thrive. lenders.occupational_info: I am an ex-CUSO volunteer (1974-76) in Ghana. I have worked at many different jobs - currently working in sales from my home. Since building my own home - with loans - I have always done what is necessary to repay these - working at whatever job I could find. I appreciate the hardships encountered by those seeking loans through Kiva and I wish them much success.

lenders.name: Heidi

lenders.occupational_info: Working in higher education is very gratifying and working at a Jesuit and Marymount institution of higher learning is even more so. Among other things, the campus community is encouraged to serve others.

lenders.occupational_info: Ken is a retired  Kwantlen Polytechnic University instructor. Jenny is recently retired from being a Childcare Consultant

lenders.name: Dennis and Ruth
lenders.loan_because: we are so blessed and others have so little.  We see it as our duty to help support fellow travellers in this life.
lenders.occupational_info: We are retired educators.

lenders.name: Tom, Liz, Edith & Douglas
lenders.occupation: we comprise an accountant, teacher, five year old schoolgirl and 18 month old "baby"
lenders.loan_because: ... actually i often wonder if my family should make loans, not because of getting my money back but because of environmental consequences [of the way the money might be used] and because I worry that I am helping create a sort of artificial capital "market" that is intrinsically flawed both sides: for the lender there is FX risk and negative ROI, and within the borrower economy inflationary pressures, the threat of usury.  And I worry that someone may dislike who I lend to if they see it on Kiva, and judge me for it.  But still there are many positives to micro financing, and the question ... what would you have happen instead ?
lenders.occupational_info: My work as an accountant is pretty thankless, and at times troubling, uninspiring, relentless and disconcerting, but it is a career which continues to make me want to strive to be a better person !

lenders.name: Bailey Family
lenders.loan_because: We believe in helping people achieve their goals.
lenders.occupational_info: Teaching

lenders.name: Chris & Marija
lenders.loan_because: I like to see people working for their own better futures.

lenders.name: Mary
lenders.loan_because: I'd like to feel that perhaps in some small way I might be spreading joy in the world.

lenders.name: Margot
lenders.loan_because: We in the west generally have access to so many resources to fufill our needs and dreams.  It only seems fitting to share some of our good fortune with people less fortunate in other parts of the world.  In times of need I have been fortunate tenough o access the economic resources needed to move forward in my life.
lenders.occupational_info: I currently work as a drug and alcohol counsellor with the most marginalized people in Canada.  In addition to addictions, the people I work with struggle with criminal charges, mental health issues, poverty, racism, and many other concerns.  The Vancouver Drug Treatment Court is a diversion program designed to provide people who are commiting crime because of active addictions with an opportunity to reclaim their lives from addiction.  I also teach Buddhist meditation.

lenders.name: Carol-Lynne
lenders.loan_because: I'm intrigued by what people can accomplish with a little encouragement and help.
lenders.occupational_info: I make natural, chemical and preservative free soaps and sell them, as a small home business.

lenders.name: Ryan
lenders.loan_because: someone made me....and now i like it.
lenders.occupational_info: I make sure documents say what they mean.   (and mean what they say)

lenders.name: Sarah
lenders.loan_because: I have received lots of help and support in my life and I want to share it with others.
lenders.occupational_info: I raise and teach my children at home.

lenders.name: Jessica
lenders.loan_because: At Christmas, my family and I donate money to students in Kibaale Uganda who are in desperate need of help.  Our family donates money to a cause we believe in, instead of giving a bunch of Christmas presents to each other.   My Uncle's gift to our family this year was a gift certificate to Kiva.    Thank you Uncle Glenn!
lenders.occupational_info: Student

lenders.name: Julia
lenders.loan_because: I believe people forget how fortunate they are in life, and it's important to help those who are not.

lenders.name: Frank Petter
lenders.loan_because: it feels good

lenders.name: Jim & Bonnie
lenders.loan_because: we can, we want to, we should.
lenders.occupational_info: Jim assists scientists who study water availability. Bonnie assists women in finding housing and recovering from abusive relationships.

lenders.name: Mary
lenders.loan_because: Paying it forward is the right thing to do when you a fortunate enough to be able to.

lenders.name: J Robert
lenders.loan_because: it helps provide opportunities for other people to improve their lives

lenders.name: stacy
lenders.loan_because: How could I not?

lenders.name: Mary Susan
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do!

lenders.name: Sue
lenders.loan_because: We all live in the same world, and in that way we are all neighbors.
lenders.occupational_info: I use art and writing to portray what I love about the landscape and people of the Bering Strait Region. I run a winter emergency shelter because we have people in our community who are addicted to alcohol and who don't have a warm, safe place to sleep.

lenders.name: Nuzha
lenders.loan_because: Human beings are most effective when they work together - we survive because we help each other.  I've been helped and now I have the means to help.

lenders.name: dorothy
lenders.loan_because: I like the way Kiva lending works.  When the loan is repaid, you lend the money again to someone else, and it starts a chain of lending that can go on and on,  showing that people who have very little can still assist others.  I also enjoy reading about how people in other countries live and work, and about the small businesses they operate.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a nurse working with children and adolescents who have emotional and mental disturbances.

lenders.name: Axcie
lenders.occupational_info: Not yet working

lenders.name: Janet
lenders.loan_because: I want to share my blessings with others.
lenders.occupational_info: I am on the Mission & Service Team in our church feeding the homeless and helping others around the world that are in need.  I also do volunteer work at the Cancer Hospital.

lenders.name: Emily
lenders.loan_because: I believe that every one desrves a chance to be great at doibng something they love or enjoy.
lenders.occupational_info: It is fun going to school, you learn many new things and it is fun to see your friends too.

lenders.name: Jeff
lenders.loan_because: Entrepreneurs make the world go round!
